<small>Hebrew form: [[H8478]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּחוֺת‎</span> **preposition** ==under== (Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תַּחַתּ‎</span>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּחוֺת‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, adverb <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מן לתחת‎</span> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>320</sup>); — [[Dan.7.27|Dan 7:27]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּחוֺת כָּלשְֿׁמַיָּא‎</span> (compare Biblical Hebrew **II. 1**); in plural with suffix (as Biblical Hebrew, Syriac, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]) [[Dan.4.9|Dan 4:9]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּחֹתֹהִי‎</span> (so <lookup onclick="bdbabb('Tg')"><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>**Onk**</sup></lookup> [[Lev.15.10|Lev 15:10]]: [[BDB#Dalm|Dalm]]<sup>§ 47, 2</sup>), v[[Lev.15.18|Lev 15:18]]. With <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִן‎</span>, [[Jer.10.11|Jer 10:11]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִן תְּחוֺת שְׁמַיָּא‎</span> (compare Biblical Hebrew **III. 2**); suffix [[Dan.4.11|Dan 4:11]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןתַּֿחְתּוֺהִי‎</span> (the form as Syriac adverb above, unless a Hebraizing punct.).
